page.title: 13NON-WOODLAND:NON-FARMING
page.content: As most land in the area is well-used for farming,woodland or residential purposes the area remaining to this section was limited. Model Farm has land next to the new link road which is wetland and permanent meadow grass land. It is bordered by willows, with buttercups, rushes and reeds. Some grazing for cattle, although too wet for sheep. The land was drained at the start of the century, with latteral drains added later, enabling more gra- sing land to be obtained. With drain- ing of the land it was discovered that the first 9" is loam, the next 12" heavy clay and below that sand. A small disused quarry exists in Weston, from which some stone has been used to build houses in the village.
